categories.name: Tantra Yoga Chakra System
categories.description: Explore the seven chakras of Tantra Yoga—centers of energy that influence physical, emotional, and spiritual well-being.

subcategories.name: Lower Chakras (Root, Sacral, Solar Plexus)
subcategories.description: Focuses on the three foundational chakras associated with grounding, creativity, and personal power.

subcategories.name: Upper Chakras (Heart, Throat, Third Eye, Crown)
subcategories.description: Explores the four higher chakras linked to love, communication, intuition, and spiritual awakening.

learningUnits.title: Upper Chakras (Heart, Throat, Third Eye, Crown)

questions.question: Which chakra is located at the base of the spine?
questions.hint: It’s connected to grounding and survival instincts.
questions.explanation: The Root Chakra, or Muladhara, is found at the base of the spine and governs stability, security, and grounding.

questions.question: What element is associated with the Root Chakra?
questions.hint: Think about stability and foundation.
questions.explanation: The Root Chakra corresponds to the Earth element, representing groundedness, safety, and physical existence.

questions.question: Which color symbolizes the Root Chakra?
questions.hint: It represents vitality and survival energy.
questions.explanation: Red symbolizes the Root Chakra’s vitality, strength, and connection to the physical world.

questions.question: What is the Sanskrit name for the Sacral Chakra?
questions.hint: It translates roughly as 'one’s own abode'.
questions.explanation: The Sacral Chakra is called Svadhisthana, representing creativity, pleasure, and emotional flow.

questions.question: Where is the Sacral Chakra located?
questions.correctAnswer: Below the navel in the lower abdomen
questions.hint: It governs the reproductive and creative organs.
questions.explanation: Svadhisthana is located just below the navel and is associated with creativity, sexuality, and emotional flow.

questions.question: Which element is linked to the Sacral Chakra?
questions.hint: It symbolizes flow and flexibility.
questions.explanation: The Sacral Chakra’s element is water, representing emotional fluidity, pleasure, and creativity.

questions.question: The Solar Plexus Chakra governs which aspect of life?
questions.hint: It’s your inner fire of willpower.
questions.explanation: The Solar Plexus Chakra (Manipura) is responsible for willpower, confidence, and self-esteem.

questions.question: Which color represents the Solar Plexus Chakra?
questions.hint: It’s bright like the sun.
questions.explanation: The color yellow signifies the Solar Plexus Chakra’s radiant energy of confidence and transformation.

questions.question: What element corresponds to the Solar Plexus Chakra?
questions.hint: It represents transformation and will.
questions.explanation: The Solar Plexus Chakra’s element is fire, symbolizing power, transformation, and inner strength.

questions.question: What physical organ is most associated with the Solar Plexus Chakra?
questions.hint: It’s linked to how we 'digest' life experiences.
questions.explanation: The Solar Plexus Chakra corresponds to the digestive system, symbolizing our ability to process life and emotions.

questions.question: Which mantra is used to activate the Root Chakra?
questions.hint: It’s a single-syllable sound beginning with 'L'.
questions.explanation: The bija mantra LAM resonates with the Root Chakra, promoting grounding and stability.

questions.question: Which chakra is associated with fear and insecurity when imbalanced?
questions.hint: It governs survival and safety.
questions.explanation: An imbalanced Root Chakra often leads to fear, insecurity, and instability in life.

questions.question: What sense is connected to the Root Chakra?
questions.hint: It’s the most primal and instinctual sense.
questions.explanation: The Root Chakra relates to the sense of smell, reflecting our connection to the earth and instincts.

questions.question: Which body part is primarily governed by the Sacral Chakra?
questions.hint: It’s tied to creativity and fertility.
questions.explanation: The Sacral Chakra governs the reproductive organs, symbolizing creative and sexual energy.

questions.question: Which mantra resonates with the Sacral Chakra?
questions.hint: It’s a bija mantra that begins with 'V'.
questions.explanation: The sound 'VAM' activates the Sacral Chakra, enhancing creativity and emotional flow.

questions.question: Which chakra is located at the center of the chest?
questions.hint: It’s associated with love and compassion.
questions.explanation: The Heart Chakra, or Anahata, governs love, compassion, and emotional balance.

questions.question: Which color symbolizes the Heart Chakra?
questions.hint: It represents healing and harmony.
questions.explanation: Green symbolizes the Heart Chakra’s energy of balance, healing, and unconditional love.

questions.question: Which chakra is associated with communication?
questions.hint: It’s located at the base of the throat.
questions.explanation: Vishuddha governs communication, self-expression, and speaking one’s truth.

questions.question: What is the Sanskrit name for the Third Eye Chakra?
questions.hint: It’s the seat of intuition.
questions.explanation: Ajna, the Third Eye Chakra, governs intuition, perception, and inner vision.

questions.question: Which color represents the Third Eye Chakra?
questions.hint: It’s a deep blue tone symbolizing insight.
questions.explanation: The indigo color represents Ajna’s association with wisdom, clarity, and perception.

questions.question: Where is the Crown Chakra located?
questions.correctAnswer: At the top of the head
questions.hint: It connects you to universal consciousness.
questions.explanation: Sahasrara, the Crown Chakra, is positioned at the top of the head and connects to higher states of awareness.

questions.question: What element is associated with the Throat Chakra?
questions.hint: It represents openness and vibration.
questions.explanation: Vishuddha corresponds to the ether element, symbolizing sound, space, and communication.

questions.question: Which mantra activates the Heart Chakra?
questions.hint: It’s often chanted for love and healing.
questions.explanation: The bija mantra 'YAM' stimulates the Heart Chakra’s energy of love and compassion.

questions.question: Which sense is connected to the Throat Chakra?
questions.hint: It’s tied to vibration and sound.
questions.explanation: Vishuddha Chakra relates to the sense of hearing, reinforcing communication and expression.

questions.question: The Third Eye Chakra governs which faculty?
questions.hint: It’s your inner vision.
questions.explanation: Ajna controls intuition, psychic awareness, and perception beyond ordinary sight.
